response.answer_text: Does money really makes you look attractive ? The answer is both yes and no . lemme explain this by an example . There s generally two phases Materialistic stuffs - lets face it , yes materialistic things are pretty attractive one can pretend to be a saint but well we all know the truth . You can t deny the fact .Non-materialistic stuffs - u know there are other stuffs which are equally important like -- If you are wearing gucci heels and walking like a drunk penguin then buddy idk about you but i really dont find it attractive lol. ( how you carry yourself) -If your drive is Audi ( for ex) and as soon as you walk out of it you are treating your subordinates like shit and acting like a stupid brat , trust me buddy its a serious no no . ( how you treat others ) -Being a snob is never attractive . -Money is okay , but as soon as you open your mouth the only thing you talk is bullshit then umm , i dont think so your money is gonna make you look “attractive” . Only if the individuals viewing you *know* you have money. This goes back to how brains are wired to find a suitable, or the best possible provider, in the dominant individual. The individual with the largest amount of money will have the most potential to support a family adequately, or comfortably. Our primordial instincts still force us to believe that the most physically fit is the most attractive as a potential mate, but in modern society, this is not usually the case.
